list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor analytics notebook to optimize draw analysis
Simplified and reorganized code for analyzing draw statistics in matches. Added new visualizations, advanced metrics, and a modular betting strategy simulation to enhance usability and maintainability.

task.summary:
Add initial project setup and VirtualSportsCollector class
This commit includes the initial setup files for the project, such as IntelliJ IDEA configuration files and a basic "main.py" entry point. It also introduces the "VirtualSportsCollector" class within an IPython notebook that collects and processes virtual sports match data from the Eurobet API. The collector saves the data into CSV and Excel formats, ensuring no duplicates and maintaining a structured format.

Add virtual match data CSV files
These files contain detailed results and statistics for virtual matches on 21-11-2024. The data includes scores, odds, and outcomes for various games, providing essential information for analysis.

Add new analysis charts and LSTM model
Added new graphical analysis charts for distribution, pattern, weekly heatmap, and exact results. Introduced a new LSTM model file. Removed obsolete data source files and the `main.py` script.

Delete outdated files and update data and model files
Removed old analysis and plot files for cleanup. Updated `lstm_model.keras` and `virtual_matches_data.xlsx` to reflect recent changes. This helps in maintaining a concise and efficient codebase.

Refactor data collection and processing in parsing scripts
Optimized data collection logic by improving date handling and error management in virtual match data retrieval. Streamlined JSON decoding, enhanced compatibility with Brotli/Gzip encoding, and restructured data merging and deduplication for efficiency. Simplified notebook functionality and improved maintainability.

Refactor analytics notebook to optimize draw analysis
Simplified and reorganized code for analyzing draw statistics in matches. Added new visualizations, advanced metrics, and a modular betting strategy simulation to enhance usability and maintainability.

It also introduces the "VirtualSportsCollector" class within an IPython notebook that collects and processes virtual sports match data from the Eurobet API. The collector saves the data into CSV and Excel formats, ensuring no duplicates and maintaining a structured format.

These files contain detailed results and statistics for virtual matches on 21-11-2024. The data includes scores, odds, and outcomes for various games, providing essential information for analysis.
